org.araneaframework.uilib.form.formlist.adapter
Class DefaultFormRowHandler<K,R>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.formlist.adapter.DefaultFormRowHandler<K,R>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, FormRowHandler<K,R>, RowHandler<K,R>
Direct Known Subclasses:
IndividualFormRowHandler, ValidOnlyFormRowHandler
public abstract class DefaultFormRowHandler<K,R>
extends Object
implements FormRowHandler<K,R>

The default implementation of FormRowHandler. It is sometimes more sensible to extend this class than to implement all methods of FormRowHandler. The generic parameter K corresponds to the type of the key values, and the generic parameter R corresponds to the type of the row values.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org)
See Also:

Method Detail

initFormRow

public void initFormRow(FormRow<K,R> editableRow,
                        R row)
                 throws Exception
Description copied from interface: FormRowHandler
The underlying implementation should initialize (e.g. setting the correct open/close status) the editable row ( formRow)) that represents the given row model object. This method is usually called when building the form.

Specified by:
initFormRow in interface FormRowHandler<K,R>
Parameters:
editableRow - The editable row to initialize.
row - The row data object that the editable row represents.
Throws:
Exception

The underlying implementation should initialize the form that will be used to add new rows.

Specified by:

Parameters:
addForm - An instance of form that will be used to add new rows to the list.

addRow

public void addRow(FormWidget rowForm)
            throws Exception
Description copied from interface: FormRowHandler
This method is called when a new row was ordered to be added. The row data should be read from the supplied form (after converting and validating).

Specified by:

Parameters:
